title: Physics-Making Integrated Project-Based Learning: Cultivating Mechanics and Creativity Through Open-Ended Design Challenges

context.prior_knowledge: Basic physics knowledge (Newtonian mechanics, vectors, energy conservation) and simple engineering design experience
context.additional_context: University physics/education department-linked program for job-seeking students exploring applicability in secondary education settings, involving project execution in makerspace environments with parallel feedback sessions

learning_goals: Students can establish design plans by applying physical principles (e.g., parabolic motion, conservation of angular momentum) to solve real-world projectile motion problems.
Learners can creatively prototype within limited material conditions and derive design improvements based on measurement data.
Through team collaboration, learners can manage ambiguity in open-ended tasks, document the scientific inquiry process, and present finalized materials.

resources: Basic Materials for Projectile Construction (Foam Board, Rubber Bands, Foam Core, etc.)
Measurement Equipment (High-Speed Camera, Gyro Sensor, Smartphone Accelerometer)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
